Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Assistant Boys' Volleyball Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Assistant Boys' Volleyball Coach role at Cranston High School West is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

During practices, the Adjunct Coach Track (Sprinters) manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At J.L. Mann High, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Adjunct Coach Track (Sprinters) demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Adjunct Coach Track (Sprinters) follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Adjunct Coach Track (Sprinters) at J.L. Mann High allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

The Adjunct Coach Track (Thrower) position at J.L. Mann High is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Adjunct Coach Track (Thrower) is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At J.L. Mann High, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Adjunct Coach Track (Thrower) encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Adjunct Coach Track (Thrower) also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Adjunct Coach Track (Thrower) role at J.L. Mann High is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

Job.JobDescription:
Position Title: Head Coach Department: Athletics Reports To: Athletic Director
SUMMARY: To help each participating student achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coaches individuals in the skills necessary for excellent achievement in the sport involved. Plans and schedules a regular program of practice in season. Oversees the safety conditions of the facility or area in which assigned sport is conducted at all times that students are present. Maintains accurate statistics, records, and results of the season. Enforces discipline and sportsmanlike behavior at all times, and establishes and oversees penalties for breach of such standards by individual students. Maintains competency in rules, rule interpretations, meet procedures, coaching techniques, and general information about all aspects of the sport. Establishes performance criteria for eligibility in interscholastic competition in this sport and is consistent in establishing criteria for eligibility in competition. Adheres to a highly efficient and technically sound program of injury prevention and follow up. Works closely with the athletics director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. Recommends purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms. Maintains necessary attendance forms, insurance records, and similar paperwork. Accounts for all equipment or delegates the responsibility. Develops a consistent and positive public communications procedure through the school and media to inform the parents and the general public about the athletic program. Performs other duties as may be assigned by the Supervisor.
JOB SPECIFICATIONS SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Supervises students of particular program.
Job.CompanyDescription: Aiken County Public Sch. coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription:
Classification Title: Supplemental Coach Job Summary: We are seeking a dynamic, passionate, and skilled Supplemental Athletic Coach to assist in the development and coaching of student-athletes in various sports programs. This position will focus on enhancing individual and team performance, supporting the head coach, and promoting a positive and inclusive athletic environment. The Supplemental Athletic Coach will work closely with athletes, coaches, and staff to help guide students toward their full potential, both in sport and personal development.
Key Responsibilities: Assist the head coach with planning and implementing daily practice sessions, drills, and team strategies. Provide individualized coaching and support to athletes to help improve their technical skills, athletic performance, and teamwork. Foster a positive and motivating atmosphere that encourages the growth and development of all student-athletes. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback to improve skills, strength, and conditioning. Support the organization and management of game-day operations, including warm-ups, player preparation, and team logistics. Collaborate with coaching staff to set team goals and help track progress toward those goals. Assist in the monitoring of athlete eligibility, attendance, and participation requirements. Ensure that all practices and events comply with relevant regulations, rules, and school policies. Help maintain and organize athletic equipment and ensure the safety of all participants during training and events. Serve as a mentor and role model, promoting sportsmanship, leadership, and respect for others. Communicate regularly with parents and guardians regarding athlete progress and team matters. Contribute to the recruitment of new athletes and support the retention of current team members.
Qualifications: Previous coaching experience in the relevant sport (1-3 years preferred). Knowledge of sport-specific techniques, rules, and strategies. Ability to communicate effectively with athletes, parents, staff, and administration. Strong organizational and time-management skills. A commitment to promoting a positive and inclusive team environment. CPR and First Aid certification (or willingness to obtain). High school diploma or equivalent (Bachelor’s degree in Physical Education, Sports Management, or a related field is a plus). Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as needed.
Desired Skills & Abilities: Strong interpersonal and motivational skills to connect with athletes. Ability to adapt coaching techniques to the needs and skill levels of individual athletes. Experience with strength and conditioning, as well as injury prevention and rehabilitation. Enthusiasm for teaching and mentoring young athletes. Knowledge of current trends in sports coaching and athlete development.
Physical Requirements: Ability to participate in physical activities such as drills, conditioning, and demonstrations. Ability to lift and carry athletic equipment and materials. Ability to stand, walk, and move around frequently during practices and games.
Working Conditions: The position may require working outside in various weather conditions. Some travel may be required for away games and tournaments.
Job.Experience: 1-3 years preferred

Job.JobDescription:
The Supplemental Coach at LOWER RICHLAND HIGH SCHOOL is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Supplemental Coach is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At LOWER RICHLAND HIGH SCHOOL, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Supplemental Coach helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Supplemental Coach works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at LOWER RICHLAND HIGH SCHOOL operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent LOWER RICHLAND HIGH SCHOOL with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Supplemental Coach reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Supplemental Coach role at LOWER RICHLAND HIGH SCHOOL.

Classification Title: Supplemental Coach Job Summary: We are seeking a dynamic, passionate, and skilled Supplemental Athletic Coach to assist in the development and coaching of student-athletes in various sports programs. This position will focus on enhancing individual and team performance, supporting the head coach, and promoting a positive and inclusive athletic environment. The Supplemental Athletic Coach will work closely with athletes, coaches, and staff to help guide students toward their full potential, both in sport and personal development.
Key Responsibilities: Assist the head coach with planning and implementing daily practice sessions, drills, and team strategies. Provide individualized coaching and support to athletes to help improve their technical skills, athletic performance, and teamwork. Foster a positive and motivating atmosphere that encourages the growth and development of all student-athletes. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback to improve skills, strength, and conditioning. Support the organization and management of game-day operations, including warm-ups, player preparation, and team logistics. Collaborate with coaching staff to set team goals and help track progress toward those goals. Assist in the monitoring of athlete eligibility, attendance, and participation requirements. Ensure that all practices and events comply with relevant regulations, rules, and school policies. Help maintain and organize athletic equipment and ensure the safety of all participants during training and events. Serve as a mentor and role model, promoting sportsmanship, leadership, and respect for others. Communicate regularly with parents and guardians regarding athlete progress and team matters. Contribute to the recruitment of new athletes and support the retention of current team members.
Qualifications: Previous coaching experience in the relevant sport (1-3 years preferred). Knowledge of sport-specific techniques, rules, and strategies. Ability to communicate effectively with athletes, parents, staff, and administration. Strong organizational and time-management skills. A commitment to promoting a positive and inclusive team environment. CPR and First Aid certification (or willingness to obtain). High school diploma or equivalent (Bachelor’s degree in Physical Education, Sports Management, or a related field is a plus). Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as needed.
Desired Skills & Abilities: Strong interpersonal and motivational skills to connect with athletes. Ability to adapt coaching techniques to the needs and skill levels of individual athletes. Experience with strength and conditioning, as well as injury prevention and rehabilitation. Enthusiasm for teaching and mentoring young athletes. Knowledge of current trends in sports coaching and athlete development.
Physical Requirements: Ability to participate in physical activities such as drills, conditioning, and demonstrations. Ability to lift and carry athletic equipment and materials. Ability to stand, walk, and move around frequently during practices and games.
Working Conditions: The position may require working outside in various weather conditions.
Job.Experience: 1-3 years preferred

Job.JobDescription: Richland County School District One, South Carolina Classification Description Locations: Eau Claire High School Keenan High School Job Title: Athletic Trainer FLSA: Exempt 240 Days Salary Range: 60, 820.00 - 80, 023.00 General Statement of Job Responsible for developing and overseeing a comprehensive athletic care program that focuses on injury prevention and provides for injury evaluation, care and rehabilitation of injured athletes. Specific Duties and Responsibilities Assists coaching staff in planning, designing and implementing appropriate programs that will reduce the possibility of weather-related injuries. Develops emergency procedures for injured athletes and other students injured in school sports-related activities. Monitors the progress of injured athletes and advises coaches regarding return to practice and games. Informs and advises coaches of the progress of student athletes and the degree to which they may participate in practice and game sessions. Maintains close communication between the athletic training program and the school. Develops and implements medical protocols in conjunction with other appropriate personnel. Develops and implements rules and regulations for athletic training rooms, the athletic training program and athletic training staff. Provides medical coverage staffing for high school and middle school home athletic events and practices, as well as away games when possible. Administers first aid as needed. Evaluates and treats chronic minor injuries and related disabilities to maintain athlete's performance. Provides athletes with protective or injury-prevention devices, such as adhesive tape, bandages, braces and other special equipment. Provides medical assistance to injured athletes as prescribed by a licensed physician with respect to evaluating injuries, and referring appropriate cases to medical facilities, operating therapeutic devices and equipment, fitting braces, guards, and other devices. Supervises athletic training rooms, which includes repositioning and storing supplies and equipment, and maintaining accurate records. Performs routine safety inspections of training rooms. Ensures all athletic training staff maintain First-Aid, CPR and AED certifications. Ensures all records, logs and reports are maintained in accordance with requirements, policies and procedures. Additional Duties: Performs related duties as required. Minimum Education and Training Bachelor's degree in Athletic Training Current State of South Carolina Athletic Training Licensure through South Carolina Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation. (SCLLR) Current certification through the Board of Certification for the Athletic Trainer (BOC) Must hold a National Provider Identifier number Minimum Qualifications and Standards Required Lifting 100 pounds maximum with frequent lifting/carrying objects. Medium strength is required to position patients for examination. May assist patients as needed, assisting them on and off the exam table. Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, holidays and weekends. Conducts duties in both indoor and outdoor environments with some exposure to heat, cold, disease (through handling bodily fluids), and ethyl chloride. Requires constant attention working with students and long work hours. Strenuous physical demands are occasionally required to lift/move items up to 150 pounds. Occasional local and overnight travel is required. Performance Evaluation Job Knowledge: Knowledge of the policies, procedures and activities of the school district which pertain to the specific duties and responsibilities of the position. Knowledge of athletic training methods, techniques and procedures. Knowledge of proper maintenance and use of equipment, materials and supplies. Knowledge of athletic training equipment and devices and protective equipment. Ability to effectively manage programs and staff. Quality of Work: Maintains high standards of accuracy in exercising duties and responsibilities. Exercises immediate remedial action to correct any quality deficiencies that occur in areas of responsibility. Maintains high-quality communication and interaction with all District departments and divisions, co-workers, and the public. Quantity of Work: Performs described "Specific Duties and Responsibilities" and related assignments efficiently and effectively to produce a quantity of work that consistently meets the standards and expectations of the District. Dependability: Assumes responsibility for completing assigned work. Completes assigned work within deadlines in accordance with directives, District policy, standards, and prescribed procedures. Remains accountable to assigned responsibilities in the technical, human and conceptual areas. Attendance: Attends and remains at work regularly and adheres to District policies and procedures regarding absences and tardiness. Provides adequate notice to higher management concerning vacation time and time-off requests. Initiative and Enthusiasm: Maintains an enthusiastic, self-reliant, and self-starting approach to meet job responsibilities and accountability. Strives to anticipate work to be done, and initiates proper and acceptable direction for the completion of work with a minimum of supervision and instruction.
Job.Location: ATHLETICS, Eau Claire High School, Keenan High School, Richland County School District One, South Carolina

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 Athletic Director at Hilton Head Island High School
Job.JobDescription:
POSITION PURPOSE: To provide each enrolled student an opportunity to participate in an extracurricular athletic activity that will foster physical skills, a sense of worth and competence, a knowledge and understanding of the pleasure of sport, the principles of play, and satisfaction of being part of a team.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Organizes and administers the overall program of extracurricular athletics, both intramural and interscholastic for the assigned school. Provides leadership in the selection, assignment, and evaluation of athletic coaches and staff members. Fosters good school-community relations by keeping the community aware of and responsive to the athletic program. Promotes student athletes with post-secondary educational institutions. Assists student athletes with obtaining appropriate post-secondary educational opportunities. Assumes responsibility for the organization and scheduling of all interscholastic athletic events. Hires officials, team physicians, and security, as required, and assumes general responsibility for the proper supervision of home games. Arranges transportation for athletic contest participants. Develops and places into operation appropriate rules and regulations governing the conduct of athletic activities. Verifies each athlete's eligibility according to established physical and academic requirements of eligibility for participation in each sport. Prepares and administers the athletic program budget. Supervises all ticket sales and fund-raising events of the athletic program and assumes responsibility for proper handling of funds. Meets and/or assists with the needs of visiting teams, such as lodging, meals, towels, gymnasium services, and field assistance, as appropriate. Makes arrangements for non-school use of playing fields and facilities, within district guidelines. Arranges field and gym practice schedules. Provides for physical examination of all athletes prior to the beginning of each season. Administers the insurance program covering school athletes and assumes responsibility for all processing of reports and claims. Plans and supervises an annual recognition program for school athletes. Regularly attends and represents the school at district and state meetings regarding athletics. Assists the administration in the implementation and supervision of the district's policies regarding student, extra-curricular participation. Collects data and reports on student extra-curricular participation and requirements of Title IX. Helps to maintain physical facilities and communicates needs of the school's athletic program to school and district administration. ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Must hold a South Carolina teaching and/or administrative certification. Preference will be given to individuals with national certification in Athletic/Sports Administration. Valid driver's license.
EXPERIENCE:
A minimum of five years of experience in coaching team sports, preferably at the high school level. At least five years of teaching experience preferred. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job and are not meant to be all inclusive. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job.
Unless reasonable accommodations can be made, while performing this job the staff member shall:
Use strength to lift items needed to perform the functions of the job. Sit, stand and walk for required periods of time. Speak and hear. Use close vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception along with the ability to focus vision. Communicate effectively in English, using proper grammar and vocabulary. American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication. Reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers to handle objects and operate tools, technology equipment, computers, and/or controls. WORK PLACE EXPECTATIONS:
Work effectively with and respond to diverse cultures or backgrounds. Demonstrate professionalism and appropriate judgment in behavior, speech, and dress in a neat, clean and professional manner for the assignment and work setting. Have regular and punctual attendance. Follow all District policies, work procedures, and reasonable requests by the proper authorities. As an employee of Beaufort County School District, I am to adhere to confidentiality as directed by Federal, State and Local Laws/Regulations; and in accordance with district administrative rules as it pertains to sensitive information, employee information and student information. Failure to adhere to confidentiality may result in disciplinary actions, up to and including termination of employment. REPORTS TO: Principal
DAYS PER YEAR: 220
SALARY CLASSIFICATION: Paid on the Administrative Salary Schedule - Level 207
EMPLOYEE GROUP: Administrative
APPLICATION PROCEDURES: Must apply online by completing an "Administrative" application and adding this specific job to your online application.
FLSA STATUS: Exempt EMPLOYEE'S ACKNOWLEDGEMENT STATEMENT: 1. I have reviewed the above position description and understand its contents. 2. I am aware that my position description may be revised or updated at any time and once notified of changes, I remain responsible for knowledge of its contents. 3. I hereby certify that I possess the physical and mental ability to fulfill the essential functions of the above position with or without reasonable accommodation(s). If I require accommodation(s) in order to fulfill any or all of these functions, I agree to provide information to the District regarding the requested accommodation(s).
Job.Experience: A minimum of five years of experience in coaching team sports, preferably at the high school level.
Job.SalaryRange: Paid on the Administrative Salary Schedule - Level 207

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Football Coach position at BATTERY CREEK HIGH provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Assistant Football Coach prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At BATTERY CREEK HIGH, the Assistant Football Coach works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Assistant Football Coach encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Assistant Football Coach at BATTERY CREEK HIGH is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

The Head JV Boys Basketball position at WHALE BRANCH EARLY COLLEGE is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Head JV Boys Basketball works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Head JV Boys Basketball at WHALE BRANCH EARLY COLLEGE sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At WHALE BRANCH EARLY COLLEGE, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Head JV Boys Basketball encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Head JV Boys Basketball is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the Head JV Boys Basketball position at WHALE BRANCH EARLY COLLEGE is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

The Assistant Boys Basketball Coach role at ROBERT SMALLS LEADERSHIP ACAD is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Assistant Boys Basketball Coach is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at ROBERT SMALLS LEADERSHIP ACAD are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Assistant Boys Basketball Coach listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Assistant Boys Basketball Coach encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Assistant Boys Basketball Coach follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At ROBERT SMALLS LEADERSHIP ACAD, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Assistant Boys Basketball Coach at ROBERT SMALLS LEADERSHIP ACAD, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

POSITION PURPOSE: Prepares each participating student athlete for competition in sports activities, and helps them to achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Prioritize athletics as a supplemental program to support the academic mission of the school. • Carry out the aims and objectives of the sports program as outlined by the Athletic Director and school district administration. • Instruct athletes in individual and team fundamentals, sportsmanship, cooperation, strategy and playing tactics, and physical conditioning necessary to realize individual and team success. • Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. • Assist in planning and scheduling a regular program of practice in season. • Maintain required attendance forms, insurance records, and other related documents. • Assist in oversight of safety conditions in the facility or area in which the assigned sport is conducted at all times student athletes are present. • Assist in establishing and implementing performance criteria for academic eligibility in interscholastic competition of the identified sport. • Enforce code of conduct standards and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establish and oversee penalties for breach of standards by student athletes. • Recommend purchase of equipment, supplies, uniforms, etc. as appropriate.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Athletic Director, Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent.
QUALIFICATIONS: • Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. • Knowledge and/or background in the assigned sport. • Teaching certificate and experience preferred. • Must be able to pass criminal background check. • Valid drivers license.
EXPERIENCE: • Must have knowledge of South Carolina High School League rules and eligibility. • Must be cooperative, service-oriented, and able to work effectively with frequent interruptions. • Must possess excellent interpersonal skills. • Must have the ability to exercise good judgment, organize tasks, follow written and verbal directions, and communicate effectively.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job and are not meant to be all inclusive. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job.
Unless reasonable accommodations can be made, while performing this job the staff member shall: 1. Use strength to lift items needed to perform the functions of the job. 2. Sit, stand and walk for required periods of time. 3. Speak and hear. 4. Use close vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception along with the ability to focus vision. 5. Communicate effectively in English, using proper grammar and vocabulary. American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication. 6. Reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers to handle objects and operate tools, technology equipment, computers, and/or controls.
WORK PLACE EXPECTATIONS: 1. Work effectively with and respond to diverse cultures or backgrounds. 2. Demonstrate professionalism and appropriate judgment in behavior, speech, and dress in a neat, clean and professional manner for the assignment and work setting. 3. Have regular and punctual attendance. 4. Follow all District policies, work procedures, and reasonable requests by the proper authorities. 5. As an employee of Beaufort County School District, I am to adhere to confidentiality as directed by Federal, State and Local Laws/Regulations; and in accordance with district administrative rules as it pertains to sensitive information, employee information and student information. Failure to adhere to confidentiality may result in disciplinary actions, up to and including termination of employment.

Job.JobDescription:
POSITION PURPOSE: Prepares each participating student athlete for competition in sports activities, and helps them to achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Prioritize athletics as a supplemental program to support the academic mission of the school. Carry out the aims and objectives of the sports program as outlined by the Athletic Director and school district administration. Instruct athletes in individual and team fundamentals, sportsmanship, cooperation, strategy and playing tactics, and physical conditioning necessary to realize individual and team success. Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. Assist in planning and scheduling a regular program of practice in season. Maintain required attendance forms, insurance records, and other related documents. Assist in oversight of safety conditions in the facility or area in which the assigned sport is conducted at all times student athletes are present. Assist in establishing and implementing performance criteria for academic eligibility in interscholastic competition of the identified sport. Enforce code of conduct standards and sportsmanship like behavior at all times; establish and oversee penalties for breach of standards by student athletes. Recommend purchase of equipment, supplies, uniforms, etc. as appropriate.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Athletic Director, Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent.
QUALIFICATIONS: Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. Knowledge and/or background in the assigned sport. Teaching certificate and experience preferred. Must be able to pass criminal background check. Valid drivers license.
EXPERIENCE: Must have knowledge of South Carolina High School League rules and eligibility. Must be cooperative, service-oriented, and able to work effectively with frequent interruptions.

POSITION PURPOSE: Prepares each participating student athlete for competition in sports activities, and helps them to achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Prioritize athletics as a supplemental program to support the academic mission of the school. • Carry out the aims and objectives of the sports program as outlined by the Athletic Director and school district administration. • Instruct athletes in individual and team fundamentals, sportsmanship, cooperation, strategy and playing tactics, and physical conditioning necessary to realize individual and team success. • Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. • Assist in planning and scheduling a regular program of practice in season. • Maintain required attendance forms, insurance records, and other related documents. • Assist in oversight of safety conditions in the facility or area in which the assigned sport is conducted at all times student athletes are present. • Assist in establishing and implementing performance criteria for academic eligibility in interscholastic competition of the identified sport. • Enforce code of conduct standards and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establish and oversee penalties for breach of standards by student athletes. • Recommend purchase of equipment, supplies, uniforms, etc. as appropriate.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Athletic Director, Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent.
QUALIFICATIONS: • Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. • Knowledge and/or background in the assigned sport. • Teaching certificate and experience preferred. • Must be able to pass criminal background check. • Valid drivers license.
EXPERIENCE: • Must have knowledge of South Carolina High School League rules and eligibility. • Must be cooperative, service-oriented, and able to work effectively with frequent interruptions. • Must possess excellent interpersonal skills. • Must have the ability to exercise good judgment, organize tasks, follow written and verbal directions, and communicate effectively.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job and are not meant to be all inclusive. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job.
Unless reasonable accommodations can be made, while performing this job the staff member shall: 1. Use strength to lift items needed to perform the functions of the job. 2. Sit, stand and walk for required periods of time. 3. Speak and hear. 4. Use close vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception along with the ability to focus vision. 5. Communicate effectively in English, using proper grammar and vocabulary. American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication. 6. Reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers to handle objects and operate tools, technology equipment, computers, and/or controls.
WORK PLACE EXPECTATIONS: 1. Work effectively with and respond to diverse cultures or backgrounds. 2. Demonstrate professionalism and appropriate judgment in behavior, speech, and dress in a neat, clean and professional manner for the assignment and work setting. 3. Have regular and punctual attendance. 4. Follow all District policies, work procedures, and reasonable requests by the proper authorities. 5. As an employee of Beaufort County School District, I am to adhere to confidentiality as directed by Federal, State and Local Laws/Regulations; and in accordance with district administrative rules as it pertains to sensitive information, employee information and student information. Failure to adhere to confidentiality may result in disciplinary actions, up to and including termination of employment.
REPORTS TO: Athletic Director
DAYS PER YEAR: To be Determined
SALARY CLASSIFICATION: Paid on the Stipend Schedule
EMPLOYEE GROUP: Part-Time Temporary
APPLICATION PROCEDURES: Must apply online by completing the appropriate application and adding this specific job to your online application.
FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt
EMPLOYEE'S ACKNOWLEDGEMENT STATEMENT: 1. I have reviewed the above position description and understand its contents. 2. I am aware that my position description may be revised or updated at any time and once notified of changes, I remain responsible for knowledge of its contents. 3. I hereby certify that I possess the physical and mental ability to fulfill the essential functions of the above position with or without reasonable accommodation(s). If I require accommodation(s) in order to fulfill any or all of these functions, I agree to provide information to the District regarding the requested accommodation(s).

The Assistant Coach - Track and Field at MAY RIVER HIGH is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Assistant Coach - Track and Field is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At MAY RIVER HIGH, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Assistant Coach - Track and Field helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Assistant Coach - Track and Field works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at MAY RIVER HIGH operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent MAY RIVER HIGH with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Assistant Coach - Track and Field reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Assistant Coach - Track and Field role at MAY RIVER HIGH.

Job.JobTitle: Track Assistant Coach - Girls and Boys - Middle School
Job.JobDescription:
The Track Assistant Coach - Girls and Boys - Middle School position at Richard E Hilton provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Track Assistant Coach - Girls and Boys - Middle School prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At Richard E Hilton, the Track Assistant Coach - Girls and Boys - Middle School works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Track Assistant Coach - Girls and Boys - Middle School encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Track Assistant Coach - Girls and Boys - Middle School at Richard E Hilton is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.
Job.Experience: Preferred

Job.JobDescription:
The Lacrosse - Varsity Girls Assistant Coach at Nation Ford High School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Lacrosse - Varsity Girls Assistant Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Nation Ford High School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Lacrosse - Varsity Girls Assistant Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Lacrosse - Varsity Girls Assistant Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Lacrosse - Varsity Girls Assistant Coach at Nation Ford High School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.
Job.Experience: Preferred

Job.JobTitle: JV Boys Lacrosse Asst. Coach - High School
Job.JobDescription:
The JV Boys Lacrosse Asst. Coach - High School role at Catawba Ridge High School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the JV Boys Lacrosse Asst. Coach - High School is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Catawba Ridge High School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The JV Boys Lacrosse Asst. Coach - High School sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Catawba Ridge High School, the JV Boys Lacrosse Asst. Coach - High School is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the JV Boys Lacrosse Asst. Coach - High School at Catawba Ridge High School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Job.JobTitle: Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School
Job.JobDescription:
The Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School position at Dwayne Hartsoe is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School at Dwayne Hartsoe sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Dwayne Hartsoe, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the Boys Track Assistant Coach - High School position at Dwayne Hartsoe is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.
Job.Location: Fort Mill High School - Fort Mill, South Carolina

The Baseball - B Team Coach - 2025 at Dutch Fork High School is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. The Track - Varsity Assistant Coach (Girls) role at Irmo High School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. The Baseball - Junior Varsity Head Coach - 2025 role at Dutch Fork High School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Baseball - Junior Varsity Head Coach - 2025 is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Dutch Fork High School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Baseball - Junior Varsity Head Coach - 2025 sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Dutch Fork High School, the Baseball - Junior Varsity Head Coach - 2025 is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Baseball - Junior Varsity Head Coach - 2025 at Dutch Fork High School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

The Softball - Junior Varsity Head Coach - 2025/2026 at Chapin High School is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. Job.JobTitle: Cross Country - Varsity Head Coach - Boys
Job.JobDescription:
The Cross Country - Varsity Head Coach - Boys position at Irmo High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Cross Country - Varsity Head Coach - Boys is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Irmo High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Cross Country - Varsity Head Coach - Boys encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Cross Country - Varsity Head Coach - Boys also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Cross Country - Varsity Head Coach - Boys role at Irmo High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach position at School District Five of Lexington and Richland Counties provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At School District Five of Lexington and Richland Counties, the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach at School District Five of Lexington and Richland Counties is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

Job.JobDescription:
Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute effective training programs and practice plans. Instruct athletes in the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback. Foster a positive team culture that emphasizes discipline, effort, integrity, and mutual respect. Ensure adherence to all rules and regulations set by the school, league, or governing body. Monitor the physical and mental condition of athletes, including injury prevention and first response. Coordinate with assistant coaches, athletic trainers, and other staff. Communicate regularly with athletes, parents, and administration. Attend all practices, games, meetings, and required events. Maintain equipment and inventory related to the specific sport. Serve as a role model and mentor to student-athletes.

Excellent leadership, motivational, and organizational skills. Strong interpersonal and communication abilities. Satisfactory background report

Job.JobDescription:
Job Summary: Rock Hill Schools is seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Athletic Coach to lead, motivate, and develop athletes to reach their highest potential in both skill and character. The Athletic Coach will plan and implement practice sessions, guide athletes in training and competition, promote teamwork and sportsmanship, and ensure the health and safety of all participants.
Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute effective training programs and practice plans. Instruct athletes in the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback. Foster a positive team culture that emphasizes discipline, effort, integrity, and mutual respect. Ensure adherence to all rules and regulations set by the school, league, or governing body. Monitor the physical and mental condition of athletes, including injury prevention and first response. Coordinate with assistant coaches, athletic trainers, and other staff. Communicate regularly with athletes, parents, and administration. Attend all practices, games, meetings, and required events. Maintain equipment and inventory related to the specific sport. Serve as a role model and mentor to student-athletes.
Qualifications: Proven coaching experience in [specific sport, e.g., basketball, soccer, track, etc.]. Knowledge of sport-specific techniques, rules, and strategies. Excellent leadership, motivational, and organizational skills. Strong interpersonal and communication abilities. Satisfactory background report
Preferred: Experience coaching at the [high school/collegiate/professional] level. Relevant coaching certification (e.g., NFHS, USA Coaching, etc.)
Start Date: Determined by Human Resources.
Employment Status: Exempt
PRE-ONBOARDING REQUIREMENTS: As a condition of employment and prior to onboarding, the district will conduct a criminal history background check. The recommended candidate will be required to provide personal information necessary to complete the background check such as date of birth, gender, and race to remain in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
