The Assistant JV Coach - Baseball position at Carlisle High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Assistant JV Coach - Baseball is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Carlisle High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Assistant JV Coach - Baseball encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Assistant JV Coach - Baseball also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Assistant JV Coach - Baseball role at Carlisle High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

The Assistant Coach - Softball at Carlisle High School is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. This position is built for a coach who enjoys being actively involved in every aspect of the program, from leading warm‑ups and teaching tactics to meeting with families and coordinating logistics. The coach is expected to bring consistency and enthusiasm to each interaction with the team.
Practices led by the Assistant Coach - Softball are structured and purposeful. They begin with appropriate warm‑ups, transition into focused skill work, and conclude with competitive or situational activities that resemble live play. The coach introduces concepts in manageable steps and checks for understanding, encouraging athletes to ask questions and learn the reasoning behind drills and strategies. This approach helps athletes become smarter, more confident players.
Motivation is another key component of the job. Coaches at Carlisle High School use positive reinforcement, high yet realistic expectations, and clear feedback to help athletes push themselves. The Assistant Coach - Softball recognizes effort and improvement, not just outcomes, and supports athletes through setbacks. This creates an environment where students are willing to take risks and grow.
The role also includes a strong communication element. The coach keeps families informed about schedules, travel, and program expectations, and responds to questions in a respectful, timely manner. Within the school, the Assistant Coach - Softball collaborates with administrators and teachers to support students’ academic responsibilities, reinforcing that success in the classroom is essential.
Finally, the position requires adherence to safety and policy standards. The Assistant Coach - Softball maintains appropriate supervision ratios, follows guidelines on equipment use, and ensures that emergency procedures are understood and practiced. The coach models appropriate conduct toward officials and opponents, reinforcing that competing with integrity is a core expectation at Carlisle High School. This comprehensive role is well suited to coaches who are organized, student‑focused, and eager to contribute to a strong athletic tradition.

Job.JobTitle: Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach at Carlisle High School is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Carlisle High School, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Carlisle High School operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Carlisle High School with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Assistant Middle School Girls Soccer Coach role at Carlisle High School.

Job.JobTitle: Head Middle School Girls Soccer Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Head Middle School Girls Soccer Coach at Carlisle Area School District is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Head Middle School Girls Soccer Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Carlisle Area School District, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Head Middle School Girls Soccer Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Head Middle School Girls Soccer Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Head Middle School Girls Soccer Coach at Carlisle Area School District allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

The Assistant Coach - Wrestling role at Carlisle High School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Assistant Coach - Wrestling is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Carlisle High School are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Assistant Coach - Wrestling listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Assistant Coach - Wrestling encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Assistant Coach - Wrestling follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Carlisle High School, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Assistant Coach - Wrestling at Carlisle High School, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

Job.JobTitle: Assistant Middle School Track & Field Coach (Sprints, Jumps, or Throws knowledge preferred)
Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Middle School Track & Field Coach (Sprints, Jumps, or Throws knowledge preferred) role at Carlisle High School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Assistant Middle School Track & Field Coach (Sprints, Jumps, or Throws knowledge preferred) is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Carlisle High School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Assistant Middle School Track & Field Coach (Sprints, Jumps, or Throws knowledge preferred) sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Carlisle High School, the Assistant Middle School Track & Field Coach (Sprints, Jumps, or Throws knowledge preferred) is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Assistant Middle School Track & Field Coach (Sprints, Jumps, or Throws knowledge preferred) at Carlisle High School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Job.JobTitle: Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred)
Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred) role at Carlisle High School emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred) coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Carlisle High School, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred) reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent Carlisle High School at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred) may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred) monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Assistant Varsity Track & Field Coach (Throws, Pole Vault, or Hurdle knowledge preferred) must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Carlisle High School.

Job.JobTitle: Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach (Start Date: After The Conclusion Of The 2025-2026 Winter Season)
Job.JobDescription:
The Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach at Avon Grove High School is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Avon Grove High School, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Avon Grove High School operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Avon Grove High School with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Varsity Cheerleading Head Coach role at Avon Grove High School.

The Middle School Girls Softball Coach role at Avon Grove Middle School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Middle School Girls Softball Coach is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Avon Grove Middle School are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Middle School Girls Softball Coach listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Middle School Girls Softball Coach encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Middle School Girls Softball Coach follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Avon Grove Middle School, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Middle School Girls Softball Coach at Avon Grove Middle School, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

The Middle School Boys Lacrosse Coach role at Avon Grove Middle School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Middle School Boys Lacrosse Coach is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Avon Grove Middle School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Middle School Boys Lacrosse Coach sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Avon Grove Middle School, the Middle School Boys Lacrosse Coach is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Middle School Boys Lacrosse Coach at Avon Grove Middle School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Join the Avon Grove School District as an Athletic Trainer
Why Choose Avon Grove? At Avon Grove School District, we don’t just offer jobs—we offer careers with purpose. We are a district on the move, with bold ideas, strong leadership. Avon Grove School District strives to ensure that all students and staff feel connected, accepted, and valued. We believe that every team member matters, and that true success comes from working as a “Team of Teams”—collaborating across buildings, roles, and grade levels to deliver extraordinary learning experiences. If you’re looking for a place where you can grow, innovate, and make a real difference in the lives of students every day, Avon Grove is the place for you. You’ll join a school and district culture where your voice is valued, and your work truly matters.
Our Vision for the Future All Avon Grove students are well prepared to create their futures. “Together Today - The AG Way!” A daily reminder that we’re in this together, united in purpose, and committed to excellence—every day, in every classroom. We’re seeking Athletic Trainers who are: Passionate about student success A collaborative team player Committed to continuous growth Ready to lead with heart and purpose
What You’ll Do Inspire and support students to reach their full potential Collaborate with colleagues in a supportive, team-based environment Contribute to a culture of high expectations and continuous improvement Use innovative strategies and tools to enhance student experiences
Qualifications Athletic Training Licensure (ATC) from the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania Certification by the Board of Certification (BOC) for Athletic Training Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR), Automated External Defibrillator (AED), and First Aid certifications Maintain Continuing Education Units (CEUs) in accordance with BOC requirements
Education, Training, and Experience Bachelor's degree in Athletic Training, Kinesiology, Sports Medicine or a related field Master's degree, preferred Experience working with middle and high school or collegiate athletes preferred
Schedule and Deatails Hours for this position vary depending on game times, practices times, and different points in the season This position's hours are primarily after school with some differences on days when school is not in session This position may require hours around or on weekends and holidays for team practices/contests, however practices will be blocked together when possible AGSD employs 2 full-time athletic trainers providing the ability for collaboration. This position provides the AT with the opportunity to rotate to two different campuses serving different sports at each location. This position serves both middle school and high school athletes.
What We Offer You Competitive salary and benefits package A collaborative, growth-focused culture Access to state-of-the-art facilities and technology Professional development opportunities at every level A district that truly values wellness, balance, and belonging
Individuals currently employed by the Avon Grove School District who are interested in applying for this position must submit an internal application for this position through https://www.applitrack.com/avongrove/onlineapp/
External applicants who are interested in applying for this position must complete an application on https://www.applitrack.com/avongrove/onlineapp/
NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY: The Avon Grove School District is an equal opportunity education institution and will not discriminate in its educational programs, activities, or employment practices on the basis of race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, religion, ancestry, sexual orientation, handicap/disability, union membership, or other legally protected classification. Announcement of this policy is in accordance with state and federal laws, including Title VI, Title IX, and Section 504.

Job.JobTitle: Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach role at Cedar Crest High School emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Cedar Crest High School, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent Cedar Crest High School at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Football - Assistant Coach - JV Head Coach must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Cedar Crest High School.
Job.Location: Cedar Crest High School, 115 East Evergreen Road Lebanon, PA 17042

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Tier I Football Coach at Red Lion Area Senior High School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Assistant Tier I Football Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Red Lion Area Senior High School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Assistant Tier I Football Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Assistant Tier I Football Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Assistant Tier I Football Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Red Lion Area Senior High School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

The Boys Tennis Head Coach at Quakertown High School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Boys Tennis Head Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Quakertown High School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Boys Tennis Head Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Boys Tennis Head Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Boys Tennis Head Coach at Quakertown High School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

The Assistant III Girls Track Coach at Quakertown High School is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the Assistant III Girls Track Coach is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At Quakertown High School, the Assistant III Girls Track Coach helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The Assistant III Girls Track Coach may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents Quakertown High School well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The Assistant III Girls Track Coach follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.

Coaching or playing experience preferred. Interested candidates should contact Seth Pehanich at spehanich@mbgsd.org or 717-691-4538. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.
Any individual who is to be considered for employment must provide school district officials with a valid Criminal History Record Clearance form, a valid Child Abuse History Clearance form, FBI Clearance, Act 168 form(s), and an I-9 (Employment Eligibility Verification) form.
NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY Mechanicsburg Area School District is an equal opportunity education institution and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, handicap or age in its activities, programs or employment practices as required by Title VI, Title IX and Section 504, and ADA. For information regarding civil rights or grievance procedures, contact Human Resources at 600 S. Norway Street, 2nd Floor, Mechanicsburg, PA 17055-41909 (717-691-4500).
Job.Experience: Coaching or playing experience preferred

Job.JobDescription:
The PWMS Basketball, Boys Head Coach position at Leon Howard is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the PWMS Basketball, Boys Head Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The PWMS Basketball, Boys Head Coach at Leon Howard sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Leon Howard, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The PWMS Basketball, Boys Head Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The PWMS Basketball, Boys Head Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the PWMS Basketball, Boys Head Coach position at Leon Howard is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.
Job.SalaryRange: In accordance with the negotiated contact

Job.JobDescription:
The PWMS Basketball, Girls Asst. Coach position at Leon Howard is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The PWMS Basketball, Girls Asst. Coach is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Leon Howard, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The PWMS Basketball, Girls Asst. Coach encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The PWMS Basketball, Girls Asst. Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the PWMS Basketball, Girls Asst. Coach role at Leon Howard is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.SalaryRange: In accordance with the negotiated contact

Job.JobDescription:
Muhlenberg High School has a vacancy for an Assistant High School Baseball Coach. Beginning Spring 2026 season
Successful candidates should believe in the importance of the impact of extra-curricular activities in a child's K-12 experience and overall social, emotional and academic development.
Preferred: • Prior coaching experience in scholastic baseball • Bilingual candidates
Required: • High School Diploma • Knowledge of sport/ Experience in the sport • Ability to work in a team setting and within the philosophy of the High School Head Coach • Ability to give clear direction • Ability to supervise and direct others • Must be interested in supporting and working with all student-athletes • Knowledge of PIAA rules and policies governing the sport • Ability to work within the Blueprint/Action Plan of the Muhlenberg School District • Clearly communicate to student athletes, parents, school officials and sport officials
Interested applicants must have current clearances, Acts 34, 114, 151 and 168 and three professional references.
The successful candidate will be required to participate in all training as required by PIAA.

Job.JobDescription:
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 1.14.25
Cheltenham School District announces the following extra duty-extra pay position is available for the 2025-2026 school-year, at Cheltenham High School:
Flag Football - Assistant Coaches
Reports to: Head Coach and Athletic Director
Job Description 1. The Assistant Coach is responsible for assisting the Head Coach with the development, implementation, and monitoring of the athletic program for the assigned sport. 2. Assist the Head Coach with the supervision of participants of the assigned sport during program related activities. 3. The Assistant Coach will serve as a positive role model to the student athletes and represents the Cheltenham School district in a well-respected manner. 4. The Assistant Coach must demonstrate an ability to work cooperatively and enthusiastically with the entire school community and demonstrate strong interpersonal skills.
All applicants: Must complete the on-line application to be considered for this position, which is located under Employment Opportunities at www.cheltenham.org.
External candidates: If hired, you will be required to provide Acts 34, 114, and 151 clearances and other mandatory employment forms.
Position vacancies will remain posted until filled.
CHELTENHAM SCHOOL DISTRICT 2000 ASHBOURNE ROAD, ELKINS PARK, PA 19027
Job Requirements No experience required
Contact Information Nikeya Pressley 2000 Ashbourne Road Elkins Park, Pennsylvania 19027 Phone: (215) 886-9500 Email: npressley@cheltenham.org
Job.Experience: No experience required

Job.JobDescription:
Lacrosse [Boys] - Assistant Coach
Must have extensive knowledge of the sport and the ability to effectively teach and communicate fundamental skills. Must have at least 2 - 4 years of coaching experience working with children and/or adolescents; coaching at the high school level preferred. A strong understanding of the sport's theory and practice is required; experience as a player or coach at the high school or collegiate level is preferred. Must demonstrate the personal qualities necessary to foster sportsmanship and support student-athlete success in a positive and encouraging environment. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication, organizational, and collaboration skills, along with a proven ability to build relationships with student-athletes, parents, staff, and school administration. Applicants must be prepared to submit required background checks that are no more than one year old from the date of issue, in accordance with state law.
All applicants: Must complete the on-line application to be considered for this position, which is located under Employment Opportunities at www.cheltenham.org. External candidates: If hired, you will be required to provide Acts 34, 114, and 151 clearances and other mandatory employment forms.
Job.Experience: 2-4 years

Job.JobDescription:
The EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Assistant (JV) - Posting #1766 at Nikeya Pressley is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Assistant (JV) - Posting #1766 plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Nikeya Pressley reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Assistant (JV) - Posting #1766 expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Assistant (JV) - Posting #1766 supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Assistant (JV) - Posting #1766 may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Nikeya Pressley. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

The EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Head Coach - Posting #1764 at Nikeya Pressley is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Head Coach - Posting #1764 is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Nikeya Pressley, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Head Coach - Posting #1764 helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Head Coach - Posting #1764 works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Nikeya Pressley operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Nikeya Pressley with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Head Coach - Posting #1764 reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the EDEP: 2025-26 Softball: Head Coach - Posting #1764 role at Nikeya Pressley.

Job.JobTitle: EDEP: 2025-26 Tennis [Boys] - MS - Head Coach - Posting #1759
Job.JobDescription:
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 11.11.25
Cheltenham School District announces the following extra duty-extra pay position(s) is available for the 2025-2026 school-year, at Cedarbrook Middle School:
Tennis [Boys] - Head Coach
Must have extensive knowledge of the sport and the ability to effectively teach and communicate fundamental skills. Must have at least 2 - 4 years of coaching experience working with children and/or adolescents; coaching at the high school level preferred. A strong understanding of the sport's theory and practice is required; experience as a player or coach at the high school or collegiate level is preferred. Must demonstrate the personal qualities necessary to foster sportsmanship and support student-athlete success in a positive and encouraging environment. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication, organizational, and collaboration skills, along with a proven ability to build relationships with student-athletes, parents, staff, and school administration. Applicants must be prepared to submit required background checks that are no more than one year old from the date of issue, in accordance with state law.
All applicants: Must complete the on-line application to be considered for this position, which is located under Employment Opportunities at www.cheltenham.org. External candidates: If hired, you will be required to provide Acts 34, 114, and 151 clearances and other mandatory employment forms.
CHELTENHAM SCHOOL DISTRICT 2000 ASHBOURNE ROAD, ELKINS PARK, PA 19027
Job.Experience: 2-4 years

Job.JobDescription:
The EDEP: 2025-26 Baseball - Assistant Coach - Posting #1745 role at Nikeya Pressley emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the EDEP: 2025-26 Baseball - Assistant Coach - Posting #1745 coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Nikeya Pressley, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The EDEP: 2025-26 Baseball - Assistant Coach - Posting #1745 reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent Nikeya Pressley at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The EDEP: 2025-26 Baseball - Assistant Coach - Posting #1745 may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The EDEP: 2025-26 Baseball - Assistant Coach - Posting #1745 monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The EDEP: 2025-26 Baseball - Assistant Coach - Posting #1745 must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Nikeya Pressley.

Job.JobDescription:
The EDEP 2025-26 - Basketball (Boys) - Assistant Coach - Posting #1640 at Cheltenham High School - Wyncote is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the EDEP 2025-26 - Basketball (Boys) - Assistant Coach - Posting #1640 manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Cheltenham High School - Wyncote, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The EDEP 2025-26 - Basketball (Boys) - Assistant Coach - Posting #1640 demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The EDEP 2025-26 - Basketball (Boys) - Assistant Coach - Posting #1640 follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the EDEP 2025-26 - Basketball (Boys) - Assistant Coach - Posting #1640 at Cheltenham High School - Wyncote allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Reports to: Head Coach and Athletic Director Job Description 1. The Assistant Coach is responsible for assisting the Head Coach with the development, implementation, and monitoring of the athletic program for the assigned sport. 2. Assist the Head Coach with the supervision of participants of the assigned sport during program related activities. 3. The Assistant Coach will serve as a positive role model to the student athletes and represents the Cheltenham School district in a well-respected manner. 4. The Assistant Coach must demonstrate an ability to work cooperatively and enthusiastically with the entire school community and demonstrate strong interpersonal skills.
All applicants: Must complete the on-line application to be considered for this position, which is located under Employment Opportunities at www.cheltenham.org.
External candidates: If hired, you will be required to provide Acts 34, 114, and 151 clearances and other mandatory employment forms.
Position vacancies will remain posted until filled.
CHELTENHAM SCHOOL DISTRICT 2000 ASHBOURNE ROAD, ELKINS PARK, PA 19027
