Job.JobDescription: POSITION PURPOSE: Prepares each participating student athlete for competition in sports activities, and helps them to achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Prioritize athletics as a supplemental program to support the academic mission of the school. Carry out the aims and objectives of the sports program as outlined by the Athletic Director and school district administration. Instruct athletes in individual and team fundamentals, sportsmanship, cooperation, strategy and playing tactics, and physical conditioning necessary to realize individual and team success. Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. Assist in planning and scheduling a regular program of practice in season. Maintain required attendance forms, insurance records, and other related documents. Assist in oversight of safety conditions in the facility or area in which the assigned sport is conducted at all times student athletes are present. Assist in establishing and implementing performance criteria for academic eligibility in interscholastic competition of the identified sport. Enforce code of conduct standards and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establish and oversee penalties for breach of standards by student athletes. Recommend purchase of equipment, supplies, uniforms, etc. as appropriate. ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Athletic Director, Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent. QUALIFICATIONS: Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. Knowledge and/or background in the assigned sport. Teaching certificate and experience preferred. Must be able to pass criminal background check. Valid drivers license. EXPERIENCE: Must have knowledge of South Carolina High School League rules and eligibility. Must be cooperative, service-oriented, and able to work effectively with frequent interruptions. Must possess excellent interpersonal skills. Must have ability to exercise good judgment, organize tasks, follow written and verbal directions, and communicate effectively. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job and are not meant to be all inclusive. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential responsibilities and functions of the job. Unless reasonable accommodations can be made, while performing this job the staff member shall: 1. Use strength to lift items needed to perform the functions of the job. 2. Sit, stand and walk for required periods of time. 3. Speak and hear. 4. Use close vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception along with the ability to focus vision. 5. Communicate effectively in English, using proper grammar and vocabulary. American Sign Language or Braille may also be considered as acceptable forms of communication. 6. Reach with hands and arms and use hands and fingers to handle objects and operate tools, technology equipment, computers, and/or controls. WORK PLACE EXPECTATIONS: 1. Work effectively with and respond to diverse cultures or backgrounds. 2. Demonstrate professionalism and appropriate judgment in behavior, speech, and dress in a neat, clean and professional manner for the assignment and work setting. 3. Have regular and punctual attendance. 4. Follow all District policies, work procedures, and reasonable requests by the proper authorities. 5. As an employee of Beaufort County School District, I am to adhere to confidentiality as directed by Federal, State and Local Laws/Regulations; and in accordance with district administrative rules as it pertains to sensitive information, employee information and student information. Failure to adhere to confidentiality may result in disciplinary actions, up to and including termination of employment. REPORTS TO: Athletic Director DAYS PER YEAR: To be Determined SALARY CLASSIFICATION: Paid on the Stipend Schedule EMPLOYEE GROUP: Part-Time Temporary APPLICATION PROCEDURES: Must apply online by completing the appropriate application and adding this specific job to your online application. FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt EMPLOYEE’S ACKNOWLEDGEMENT STATEMENT: 1. I have reviewed the above position description and understand its contents.
Job.Experience: Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport.

POSITION PURPOSE: Prepares each participating student athlete for competition in sports activities, and helps them to achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Prioritize athletics as a supplemental program to support the academic mission of the school. • Carry out the aims and objectives of the sports program as outlined by the Athletic Director and school district administration. • Instruct athletes in individual and team fundamentals, sportsmanship, cooperation, strategy and playing tactics, and physical conditioning necessary to realize individual and team success. • Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. • Assist in planning and scheduling a regular program of practice in season. • Maintain required attendance forms, insurance records, and other related documents. • Assist in oversight of safety conditions in the facility or area in which the assigned sport is conducted at all times student athletes are present. • Assist in establishing and implementing performance criteria for academic eligibility in interscholastic competition of the identified sport. • Enforce code of conduct standards and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establish and oversee penalties for breach of standards by student athletes. • Recommend purchase of equipment, supplies, uniforms, etc. as appropriate.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Athletic Director, Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent.
QUALIFICATIONS: • Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. • Knowledge and/or background in the assigned sport. • Teaching certificate and experience preferred. • Must be able to pass criminal background check. • Valid drivers license. EXPERIENCE: • Must have knowledge of South Carolina High School League rules and eligibility. • Must be cooperative, service-oriented, and able to work effectively with frequent interruptions. • Must possess excellent interpersonal skills. • Must have the ability to exercise good judgment, organize tasks, follow written and verbal directions, and communicate effectively.

The Football Coordinator - High School role at Nation Ford High School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Football Coordinator - High School is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Nation Ford High School are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Football Coordinator - High School listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Football Coordinator - High School encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Football Coordinator - High School follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Nation Ford High School, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Football Coordinator - High School at Nation Ford High School, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.
Job.Location: Nation Ford High School - Fort Mill, South Carolina
Job.Experience: Preferred

Job.JobDescription: Reports To: School Athletic Director and/or School Administration Job Summary: Rock Hill Schools is seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Athletic Coach to lead, motivate, and develop athletes to reach their highest potential in both skill and character. The Athletic Coach will plan and implement practice sessions, guide athletes in training and competition, promote teamwork and sportsmanship, and ensure the health and safety of all participants. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute effective training programs and practice plans. Instruct athletes in the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback. Foster a positive team culture that emphasizes discipline, effort, integrity, and mutual respect. Ensure adherence to all rules and regulations set by the school, league, or governing body. Monitor the physical and mental condition of athletes, including injury prevention and first response. Coordinate with assistant coaches, athletic trainers, and other staff. Communicate regularly with athletes, parents, and administration. Attend all practices, games, meetings, and required events. Maintain equipment and inventory related to the specific sport. Serve as a role model and mentor to student-athletes. Qualifications: Proven coaching experience in [specific sport, e.g., basketball, soccer, track, etc.]. Knowledge of sport-specific techniques, rules, and strategies. Excellent leadership, motivational, and organizational skills. Strong interpersonal and communication abilities. Satisfactory background report Preferred: Experience coaching at the [high school/collegiate/professional] level. Relevant coaching certification (e.g., NFHS, USA Coaching, etc.) Start Date: Determined by Human Resources PRE-ONBOARDING REQUIREMENTS: As a condition of employment and prior to onboarding, the district will conduct a criminal history background check. The recommended candidate will be required to provide personal information necessary to complete the background check such as date of birth, gender, and race to remain in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. DISCLAIMER: The District reserves the right to modify job postings and/or job descriptions at any time to meet organizational needs. EEOC STATEMENT: Rock Hill Schools provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Position Type: Seasonal
Job.Location: Northwestern High School - Rock Hill, South Carolina
Job.Experience: Proven coaching experience, Experience coaching at the [high school/collegiate/professional] level.

Job.JobDescription:
The Men's Volleyball Head Coach at Northwestern High School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Men's Volleyball Head Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Northwestern High School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Men's Volleyball Head Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Men's Volleyball Head Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Men's Volleyball Head Coach at Northwestern High School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.
Job.Location: Northwestern High School - Rock Hill, South Carolina

Job.JobDescription:
Position Title: Athletic Trainer Department: Instructional Services Reports To: Principal FLSA Status: Exempt
REQUIRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree in athletic training, physical therapy, or related discipline. Minimum of two years experience or applicable clinical affiliations; or any equivalent combination of training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS: Valid South Carolina Athletic Trainers' certification (S.C.A.T.) Must have current government issued identification TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT: 8 Hours/190 Days
GENERAL SUMMARY: To provide athletic training services to high school athletes in Lexington County School District One; to serve as liaison between physicians and other health care professionals, coaches, athletes and parents; to maintain athletic training facilities and equipment; to perform related work as required.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Prevention - Develops and implements conditioning programs for athletes to prevent injuries. - Develops and implements programs to educate coaches and athletes on the prevention of athletic injuries. - Applies protective taping and bracing to prevent athletic injuries. - Advises coaches and/or athletic director on the selection, fit, function, and maintenance of athletic equipment. Evaluation, Immediate Care, Treatment, and Rehabilitation - Provides athletic training coverage for a variety of home varsity athletic events; is on-call for junior varsity athletic events. - Evaluates and treats athletic injuries and conditions that occur during the course of school-sponsored athletic participation. - Determines and recommends when referral to physician or other healthcare provider is appropriate. - Recommends when an athlete may return to participation after injury. - Provides for regularly scheduled sessions for the evaluation and treatment of athletic injuries. - Ensures that appropriate athletic training equipment and supplies are available and accessible when covering an athletic event. - Prescribes therapeutic exercises. - Operates and maintains therapeutic modalities, rehabilitation equipment, and diagnostic instruments. Organization and Administrative - Assists parent/athlete in making appointments for further evaluation with affiliated physicians. - Establishes relationships with physician(s) who will serve as team physician(s) for athletic programs. - Renders athletic training services under the advice and consent of a licensed physician as required by state practice act. - Communicates regularly with physicians regarding referrals and advisement. - Acts as a liaison between physicians, the school, coaches, parents, and the athlete regarding issues of injury and health. - Maintains accurate records of injuries and treatments. - Administers athletic insurance claims; answers insurance questions. - Provide coaches and athletic director a list of athletes medically eligible to compete under district and state guidelines. - Maintains medical records of athletes in accordance with state practice act. - Supervises athletic training staff including assistant athletic trainer(s) and student athletic trainers. Education & Counseling - Coordinates student athletic trainer program. - Counsels athletes regarding special needs such as diet, medications, drug abuse, STDs, etc. - Maintains knowledge of current professional issues by reading journals, attending conferences, etc. - Teaches classes in specialty areas such as sports medicine and health science (limited to no more than .3 Instructional FTE). - Assist athletics director as requested. - Meets with parents, administrators and school counselors as needed to discuss student performance, activities, etc. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: Responsible for athletic training room equipment and supplies. Supervises student athletic trainers and students in medical/therapy situations. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES: Ability to perform duties with awareness of all district requirements and Lexington County School District One Board policies. Must be able to access reliable transportation. Knowledge of the policies, procedures and activities of the school district which pertain to the specific duties and responsibilities of the position. Knowledge of the records, forms and reports which must be prepared and maintained. Knowledge of emergency procedures and first aid techniques. Knowledge of athletic training methods, techniques and procedures. Knowledge of proper maintenance and use of equipment, materials and supplies used in daily activities. Knowledge of methods used in instruction and evaluation of student athletic trainers. Knowledge of counseling methods necessary for handling athletes' special needs. Knowledge of athletic training equipment and devices and protective equipment. Knowledge of current professional issues. Knowledge of school safety issues. Ability to provide athletic training services. Ability to perform emergency procedures and first aid techniques. Ability to operate athletic training devices and equipment. Ability to fabricate and ensure fit of protective equipment. Ability to maintain and interpret records and reports. Ability to provide training, instruction and guidance of student athletic trainers through explanation, demonstration and supervised practice. Ability to identify athletes' problems, provide counseling and/or recommend appropriate action. Ability to demonstrate high level application of technology devices necessary for daily activities. Ability to communicate effectively with students and their parents, district staff, coaches, medical personnel, and all other groups involved in the activities of the job. Ability to perform manual work requiring some physical strength and agility. Personal computer experience required. Strong knowledge of word processing, e-mail, spreadsheets, electronic file management, the internet, and reporting and presentation software. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with students, staff and the school community. Ability to speak clearly and concisely both in oral and written communication. Ability to apply knowledge and current research and theory. Ability to organize and implement a flexible work schedule in order to meet reporting deadlines. Ability to self-monitor and manage multiple tasks while working individually and with members of a group. Ability to submit all requested reports and documentation in a timely manner and in accordance with scheduled deadlines. Some extended hours and multiple demands from several people are frequently required of the employee. Computer literacy required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Job.Experience: Minimum of two years experience or applicable clinical affiliations

Job.JobDescription:
Position Title: Coach Department: Student Services Reports To: Principal/Athletic Director FLSA Status: Not applicable
REQUIRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: • Experience as a participant or coach of the assigned sport; or any equivalent combination of training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS: Must have current government issued identification TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT: Seasonal part-time Athletics Salary Schedule
The terms of employment detailed in this job description are based on full time employment during the school year. Conditions of employment may be adjusted for part time employees or individuals who are hired for less than an entire school year.
GENERAL SUMMARY: Under general supervision of the athletic director, instructs students in a sport to obtain a high skill level, an appreciation of discipline and sportsmanship, and increased self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Supports and upholds the mission, vision and strategic goals of Lexington County School District One towards increased outcomes for students. • Interacts, communicates and collaborates with all stakeholders effectively. • Establishes a safe, supportive, positive and productive working and learning environment. • Operates general office and technology equipment needed for daily activities. • Maintains confidentiality regarding all employee and student information. • Participates in all professional meetings and training sessions as required. • Requests and maintains materials needed for daily responsibilities and essential functions; provides for safe storage and proper use of all tools, equipment and materials. • Explains and demonstrates use of apparatus and equipment. • Explains and demonstrates principles, techniques, and methods of regulating movement of the body, hands, or feet to achieve proficiency in activity. • Plans and schedules a regular program of practice; observes students during practice to detect and correct mistakes. • Explains and enforces safety rules and regulations. • Oversees the safety conditions of the facility or area in which assigned sport is conducted. • Explains methods of keeping score. • Organizes and conducts competitions and tournaments. • Works closely with the athletic director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests and in assuring adequate publicity for the assigned sport. • Establishes and enforces performance criteria for eligibility in interscholastic competition in each assigned sport. • Enforces discipline and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establishes and oversees penalties for breach of such standards by individual students. • Recommends purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms as appropriate to the athletic director. • Assumes responsibility as assigned for maintaining equipment, storage areas, and playing areas for assigned sport. • Assumes responsibility for students at all times during the school day and supervises students on the grounds as assigned by the principal. • Meets with parents, administrators and school counselors as needed to discuss student performance, activities, etc. • Performs other job-related duties as assigned
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: Responsible for athletic equipment and facilities. Supervises students participating in sport being coached.
OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES: Ability to perform duties with awareness of all district requirements and Lexington County School District One Board policies. Must be able to access reliable transportation. Knowledge of the policies, procedures, and activities of the school district which pertain to the specific duties and responsibilities of the position. Knowledge of school policies, procedures, and operations. Ability to demonstrate proper maintenance, safe operation, and utilization of equipment, materials, and supplies used in daily activities. Ability to maintain high standards of accuracy in exercising duties. Ability to anticipate work to be completed and to complete work without the need for direct supervision. Ability to maintain confidentiality of employee and student records and information. Ability to interact and communicate in an effective and professional manner with supervisors, co-workers, teachers, students, and the general public. Personal computer experience required. Strong knowledge of word processing, e-mail, spreadsheets, electronic file management, the internet, and reporting and presentation software. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with students, staff and the school community. Ability to speak clearly and concisely both in oral and written communication. Ability to apply knowledge and current research and theory. Ability to organize and implement a flexible work schedule in order to meet reporting deadlines. Ability to self-monitor and manage multiple tasks while working individually and with members of a group. Ability to submit all requested reports and documentation in a timely manner and in accordance with scheduled deadlines. Some extended hours and multiple demands from several people are frequently required of the employee. Computer literacy required.
Job.Experience: Experience as a participant or coach of the assigned sport; or any equivalent combination of training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities.

Job.JobDescription:
The Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach at Fort Dorchester High School is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At Fort Dorchester High School, the Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents Fort Dorchester High School well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The Head Mens Varsity Swim Coach follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.

The Head Womens Varsity Swim Coach at Fort Dorchester High School is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Head Womens Varsity Swim Coach is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Fort Dorchester High School, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Head Womens Varsity Swim Coach helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Head Womens Varsity Swim Coach works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Fort Dorchester High School operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Fort Dorchester High School with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Head Womens Varsity Swim Coach reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Head Womens Varsity Swim Coach role at Fort Dorchester High School.

The Middle School Football Coach at Oakbrook Middle School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Middle School Football Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Oakbrook Middle School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Middle School Football Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Middle School Football Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Middle School Football Coach at Oakbrook Middle School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Job.JobTitle: ASST. GIRLS SOCCER ADJUNCT COACH (JOB ID: 24325)

Our Human Resources Team at the Greenville County School District is dedicated to advancing student achievement by recruiting and employing the highest qualified staff for our schools and to serve those with whom we work.

Our jobs require a “people person” that indicates through actions a personality that is conducive to positive interactions with students, staff and parents.

The Assistant Coach - Baseball at Colonia High School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Assistant Coach - Baseball plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Colonia High School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Assistant Coach - Baseball expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Assistant Coach - Baseball supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Assistant Coach - Baseball may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Colonia High School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

The Unified Basketball (Winter Season) position at Perth Amboy High School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Unified Basketball (Winter Season) works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Unified Basketball (Winter Season) at Perth Amboy High School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Perth Amboy High School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Unified Basketball (Winter Season) encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Unified Basketball (Winter Season) is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the Unified Basketball (Winter Season) position at Perth Amboy High School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

The Unified Track (Spring Season) position at Perth Amboy High School provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Unified Track (Spring Season) prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At Perth Amboy High School, the Unified Track (Spring Season) works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Unified Track (Spring Season) encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Unified Track (Spring Season) at Perth Amboy High School is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

Job.JobDescription:
ATHLETIC AND ACTIVITY DIRECTOR Reports To: Deputy Superintendent Salary: Administrative Calendar: 240 Days
JOB SUMMARY The Athletic and Activity Director is responsible for the administration, supervision, and coordination of all district-sanctioned athletic and student activity programs for grades 7–12. The position provides leadership in developing, implementing, and sustaining a comprehensive, educationally sound athletics and activities program that aligns with district goals, Board policy, and New Mexico Activities Association (NMAA) requirements. QUALIFICATIONS Valid New Mexico Administrative License. Master’s Degree in education or related field preferred. Minimum of five years of successful teaching and/or administrative experience. Minimum of five years of successful coaching or athletic administration experience preferred. Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Superintendent may find appropriate and acceptable. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Program Leadership and Development Compliance and Eligibility Scheduling, Events, and Travel Budgeting and Financial Oversight Facilities and Event Operations Records, Recognition, and Communication Professional Responsibilities The physical demands described are representative of those required to perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, use hands to finger, handle, or feel, and talk or hear. Ability to lift and/or move up to 25 pounds Visual abilities including close, distance, color, peripheral, and depth perception WORKING CONDITIONS Mental Demands/Physical Demands/Environmental Factors: Maintain emotional control under stress, work with frequent interruptions. Some districtwide and statewide travel. Occasional, prolonged and irregular working hours. TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT Salary and work year shall be in accordance with the current administrative schedule. This is a 240-day contract. EVALUATION Performance will be evaluated in accordance with Board of Education policy on administrator evaluations. Note: This is not an exhaustive or all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, efforts, functions or working conditions associated with the job. This job description is not a contract of employment or a promise or guarantee of any specific terms or conditions of employment. The school district may add to, modify or delete any aspect of this job (or the position itself) at any time as it deems advisable. Revised February 2026 THE DEMING PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICT IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, NATIONAL ORIGIN, RELIGION, AGE, SEX, MARITAL STATUS, OR HANDICAP IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE LAWS Position Type: Full-Time Job Requirements Citizenship, residency or work visa required
Job.Experience: Minimum of five years

Job.JobDescription:
Summary: The Assistant Coach must demonstrate leadership in player and staff development, integrity, sportsmanship and character development. Qualified candidates should possess strong communication and organizational skills. They must demonstrate professional skills and strategies of their sport as it pertains to the policies of New Mexico Activities Association (NMAA).
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Assistin implementing a written team rules which includes a philosophy statement and discusses acceptable player behavior, practice procedures, substance abuse policies and other guidelines that relate to program management. Conduct a pre-season meeting with parents and players to share these policies and procedures. Have a thorough knowledge of all District and the NMAA Policies and be responsible for their implementation. Continue professional growth by attending classes, clinics, workshops, and affiliations with professional organizations. Conduct oneself as a positive role model. Assist the head coach in implementing all team rules. Turn in team rosters as directed to the head coach. Report all rule violations or suspected violations to the head coach. Consult with the Head Coach, or his/her designee, in matters of purchasing equipment, scheduling, and coaching assignments. Work to develop a positive athlete-teacher relationship. Coaches must ensure that all athletes participating in their sport are academically eligible. This includes checking grades before the start of the season and during the season as well. Every student athlete must remain eligible according to NMAA policies.
Minimum Qualifications: Valid NM Athletic Coaching License Valid New Mexico Teaching License preferred All Athletic Coaches in K-8 settings MUST be at least 18 years of age, and ALL Athletic Coaches in 9-12 settings MUST be at least 21 years of age.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Knowledge of Dine language, culture, and history preferred Good communication skills and customer service skills Understand and follow the proper administrative line of command and refer all requests or grievances through proper channels Has the ability to assist in organization and supervision of the total sports program The assistant coach must have knowledge of the technical aspects of the sport and willingness to continue to learn and examine new ideas pertinent to the assigned sport
Physical/Job Requirements: Standing, sitting, walking, lifting, carrying up to 50 pounds, climbing, bending, reaching, kneeling, driving a vehicle, traveling long distances, writing, typing, word processing, reading, researching information, and effective communication skills.

Job.JobDescription: POSITION: Girls Volleyball Head Coach LOCATION: Carson High School OPEN TO: Employees of Carson City School District and external applicants. APPLICATION PERIOD: Closes December 15, 2025 or until filled. SALARY: Stipend of 8.0% licensed salary schedule, step one, Master's Degree column. NOTE: If you are recommended for hire, you will be required to complete the First Aid/AED/CPR course prior to starting this position. If you currently have a valid First Aid/AED/CPR card, please upload a copy of your certificate with your application. APPLICATION: Complete the online application by clicking "Apply for this Position." The application will require: Cover letter Resume High School coaches are required to have the following documents: National Federation of High School coaching certificate A clear understanding of the assignment and its responsibilities, the rules of the sport, knowledge of the Carson City School District Policies and Regulations, as they apply to student activities, including the Code of Ethics; and the ability to develop a self-discipline within participating members that promotes achievement, citizenship and respect. Bi-Lingual preferred. Must be able to pass pre-employment drug screen test. This is a replacement position. REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION: The Human Resources Department will make efforts to provide reasonable accommodations to disabled candidates in the employment process. If you have special needs, please notify the Human Resources Department at the time you turn in your application or at least (3) days prior to an interview by calling (775) 283-2130. Notice of Non-Discrimination: The Carson City School District does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, or on any other basis protected by state or federal law, and it provides equal access to the Boy Scouts of America and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the District's non-discrimination policies: Title IX and 504 Coordinator, 1402 W. King Street, Carson City, NV 89703, (775) 283-2130.
Job.Experience: National Federation of High School coaching certificate required
Job.SalaryRange: $4,825.52 - $4,825.52 per unit / Stipend of 8.0% licensed salary schedule, step one, Master's Degree column

Job.JobDescription:
The 50% Freshman Girls Basketball Coach at Normandy High School is a high‑engagement coaching role that calls for energy, clear communication, and a steady presence for student‑athletes. This position is built for a coach who enjoys being actively involved in every aspect of the program, from leading warm‑ups and teaching tactics to meeting with families and coordinating logistics. The coach is expected to bring consistency and enthusiasm to each interaction with the team.
Practices led by the 50% Freshman Girls Basketball Coach are structured and purposeful. They begin with appropriate warm‑ups, transition into focused skill work, and conclude with competitive or situational activities that resemble live play. The coach introduces concepts in manageable steps and checks for understanding, encouraging athletes to ask questions and learn the reasoning behind drills and strategies. This approach helps athletes become smarter, more confident players.
Motivation is another key component of the job. Coaches at Normandy High School use positive reinforcement, high yet realistic expectations, and clear feedback to help athletes push themselves. The 50% Freshman Girls Basketball Coach recognizes effort and improvement, not just outcomes, and supports athletes through setbacks. This creates an environment where students are willing to take risks and grow.
The role also includes a strong communication element. The coach keeps families informed about schedules, travel, and program expectations, and responds to questions in a respectful, timely manner. Within the school, the 50% Freshman Girls Basketball Coach collaborates with administrators and teachers to support students’ academic responsibilities, reinforcing that success in the classroom is essential.
Finally, the position requires adherence to safety and policy standards. The 50% Freshman Girls Basketball Coach maintains appropriate supervision ratios, follows guidelines on equipment use, and ensures that emergency procedures are understood and practiced. The coach models appropriate conduct toward officials and opponents, reinforcing that competing with integrity is a core expectation at Normandy High School. This comprehensive role is well suited to coaches who are organized, student‑focused, and eager to contribute to a strong athletic tradition.

Job.JobDescription:
The J.V. Baseball Assistant Coach position at Normandy High School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the J.V. Baseball Assistant Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The J.V. Baseball Assistant Coach at Normandy High School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Normandy High School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The J.V. Baseball Assistant Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The J.V. Baseball Assistant Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the J.V. Baseball Assistant Coach position at Normandy High School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.
Job.CompanyDescription: Parma City School District coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant 7th Grade Softball Coach position at Middle School East provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Assistant 7th Grade Softball Coach prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At Middle School East, the Assistant 7th Grade Softball Coach works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Assistant 7th Grade Softball Coach encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Assistant 7th Grade Softball Coach at Middle School East is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

Job.JobTitle: Coaching - HS Varsity Asst. Track Coach - Coed
Job.JobDescription: Job Responsibilities: Serve as the Varsity Asst. Coach for the entire Track Program. Is knowledgeable about the sport and rules. Assist with developing, monitoring, supervising, and training student-athletes to participate in competitive Track. Assist with developing and executing an effective training program. Motivate and mentor student-athletes on and off the Track. Instruct and guide student-athletes in fundamental skills, strategies, and physical training necessary for them to realize a degree of individual and team success. Instruct and guide student-athletes to lead them to the formulation and enhancement of moral values, pride of accomplishment, acceptable social behavior, self-discipline, and self-confidence. Foster teamwork, sportsmanship, and skills development. Ensure the safety and well-being of student-athletes. Cooperate, in a timely manner, with School Athletic Director and the District Athletic Department in regard to requests for information that might be pertinent and/or periodically required. Meet all the requirements set forth by the District Board of Education, The Ohio High School Athletic Association (OHSAA), and The Ohio Department of Education (ODE) relative to the mandated Coaches Tool Chest (CTC) Training/ Certification and the ODE Pupil Activity Permit. Check the status of academic eligibility for all prospective student-athletes. Follow the District Athletic Department Policies as outlined in the Coaches Handbook and meet all criteria as outlined in the job description. Model the behavior expected of our student-athletes including timeliness to practices and games, being positive and enthusiastic, being respectful, and practicing constructive criticism while upholding the disciplines of the program. Maintain a suitable sideline conduct, including the use of appropriate language, at all times. Accept and profit from constructive criticism and suggestions for improving coaching performance. Recognize the need to be aware of and implement all applicable administrative polices set forth by the District Board of Education, Superintendents of Schools, School Principals, Conference Leagues, ODE, and OHSAA. Schedule and complete a full season of contests including State Tournament Games. Provide all applicable in-season training rules as well as any that may apply to out-of-season conduct to student-athletes prior to the start of the season. Follow appropriate due process procedures when violations occur. Participate in Clinics and other available programs to improve coaching performance. Participate in School events (i.e., Awards Night, Pep Assemblies, Athletic Boosters Meetings, etc. Ensure that team is well-prepared for opponents. Maintain accurate inventory of equipment and supplies. SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS: Fundraising experience Must be passionate and dedicated to inspire student-athletes. Have the ability to motivate and inspire student-athletes. Serve as a positive role model. Demonstrated knowledge and skills associated with the sport. TRAINING/CERTIFICATIONS: Ohio Secondary Teaching Certificate preferred. Evidence of successful past coaching experience at the High School and/or College level is preferred. Provide satisfactory result of County Police Records Check, State BCII Check, and a FBI Fingerprint Background Check. Possess an Ohio Department of Education (ODE) Pupil Activity Permit (PAP). Provide proof of completion of Coaches Tool Chest (CTC) Training/Certification. CONTRACT PROVISIONS: TYPE OF CONTRACT: Supplemental Annual Limited SALARY: Per Schedule E Contract of current C.F.T. Labor Agreement REPORTS TO: School Principal APPLICATION PROCEDURE: Apply online via CPS Unified Talent SELECTION PROCEDURE: Interview Job Requirements At least 3 year(s) of relevant experience preferred. Citizenship, residency or work visa required
Job.SalaryRange: Per Schedule E Contract of current C.F.T. Labor Agreement

Job.JobDescription:
The Head Cross Country Coach position at Kettering Fairmont High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Head Cross Country Coach is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Kettering Fairmont High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Head Cross Country Coach encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Head Cross Country Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Head Cross Country Coach role at Kettering Fairmont High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.CompanyDescription: Kettering City School District coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Boys Soccer Coach at Kettering Fairmont High School is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the Assistant Boys Soccer Coach is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At Kettering Fairmont High School, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The Assistant Boys Soccer Coach helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The Assistant Boys Soccer Coach works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at Kettering Fairmont High School operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent Kettering Fairmont High School with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the Assistant Boys Soccer Coach reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the Assistant Boys Soccer Coach role at Kettering Fairmont High School.

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Girls Track Coach at Van Buren Middle School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Assistant Girls Track Coach manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Van Buren Middle School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Assistant Girls Track Coach demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Assistant Girls Track Coach follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Assistant Girls Track Coach at Van Buren Middle School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Job.JobDescription:
The Assistant Boys Track Coach at Van Buren Middle School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Assistant Boys Track Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Van Buren Middle School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Assistant Boys Track Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Assistant Boys Track Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Assistant Boys Track Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Van Buren Middle School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

Job.JobTitle: LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position ***2026-2027
Job.JobDescription:
The LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 role at Lebanon Junior High School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Lebanon Junior High School are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Lebanon Junior High School, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the LJHS Cross Country Coach Assistant COED (Grades 7-8) Supplemental Position *2026 at Lebanon Junior High School, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.
